column4: harry unless you have an install server and pxe boot - your out of luck
i thought they were case sensitive.  i know linux is
they all are - thats what I just said
re-read
indeed, i did.
I said I can't believe anyone would design an app for a unix os thats case insensitive
i gotcha...it's just the wording that threw me off
no problem
what browswer would you reccomend using over and ssh connection?  not lynx or anything CLI.  i'm forwarding X to my work desktop from my home computer
want to be able to visit ebay, etc.
it goes too slow.  my net connection only u/ls at 1.5 Mb/s.  was hoping there was something lightweight that still handled graphics and whatnot
konqueror is slightly better, but still pretty sluggish
just live with it,
i would if it were livable.  > 3 minutes for google.com to come up, though, isn't very livable.
x over the internet is slow
when i tried it with an up link of 2.5 Mb/s it was pdg, with konqueror anyway.  just hoped there was a browser around that was specifically for that application, just couldn't find one.
also of note, pidgin works just as fast over the net as it does locally
its a lighter app - less to do
i'll give links2 a try. many thanks.
works like a charm.  thanks, again.
well done
